She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents, since her children are grown up.

This is Tú's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Tú has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tú faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tú hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase candy and biscuits to resell and purchase cloth to do tailoring.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with 2 children. She has received schooling through the end of junior high school. Currently, Margaret sells African print cloth and dresses in Hotopo, near Takoradi. She has been involved in this industry for about 5 years now. Her husband is a driver. Margaret's income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses. Margaret will use the loan to increase her existing African print cloth and dress inventory. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Margaret plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing African print cloth and dress inventory.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a hardworking married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For four years, he has been riding a motorcycle for a living, and with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Like most people in his business sector, he has challenges of weather changes and high fuel costs, while his business plan is to own at least three motorcycles.

Stephen intends to use the loan to buy another motorcycle, which he intends to hire out. He will get 80 percent of the daily earnings.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 29 years old and resides in his rural home in Kisii, South Rift, Kenya, with his wife and two children. He has been a farmer for seven years, producing and selling bananas, maize and milk.

He has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES 41,600 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The addition of a dairy cow will increase his level of income and improve his business. He expects to have a high yield and an improved production. His business challenge is a lack of market in the local area.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
This is Expedita. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy different products like appliances and clothes for men and women. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and meet the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Expedita hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams of a good future for her children. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different products like appliances and clothes for men and women.

loans.name: Rhubemuguma Group

texts.fr: La cliente M'macumu est présidente du groupe Rhubemuguma, entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 42 ans, veuve et mère de 5 enfants.. La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Depuis son jeune âge, elle exerce cette activité. Parmi ses 5 enfants, un n’a pas eu la chance d’étudier faute de moyens financiers. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 80 kg de farine de manioc. Elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise et construire un grand entrepôt agricole. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.
texts.en:
This client, M'macumu, is the president of the group Rhubemuguma. An energetic entrepreneur, she is 42 years old, a widow, and the mother of five children. This client sells grocery items. She has been in this business since she was young. Among her five children, one has not had the chance to go to school due to a lack of financial means.

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 80 kg of cassava flour. She would like to expand her enterprise and build a large agricultural warehouse. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its micro-loan support.

loans.use: to purchase 80 kg of cassava flour

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius resides in Kisii with his wife. He has been in farming for the past twenty years producing and selling milk, bananas, and various vegetables. He also has a motor-bike transport business locally known as "bodaboda". All his products are sold within the local markets.
He has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES. 31,200 for purchasing a dairy cow. This will increase milk production and thus a higher income thereby improving their living standards. He desires to see his farm produce high yields. His major challenge is lack of an efficient market.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a new convenience-store business.

loans.name: Esther Noemi

texts.es:
Esther es una mujer de 39 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es madre y padre para su hijo; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Esther no pudo estudiar la carrera de repostería y pastelería que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta preparar deliciosos postres para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Esther trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Esther se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la construcción de una de las paredes de su vivienda, ya que actualmente esta se encuentra deteriorada y necesita reforzarla, de esta manera Esther y su familia podrán contar con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una pastelería.
texts.en:
Esther, 39, lives in the city of Cañete, in the Imperial District, with her adored son who is her main reason for living.  She is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who dedicates all her efforts to providing for her family, since she is both mother and father to her son.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and out of necessity, she has had to work since she was very young.  Esther was unable to get training in pastry making as she would have liked, but in her free time she prepares delicious desserts to share with her family.

On her own initiative, and with much tenacity and dedication, Esther works as a hired hand on a farm in her city.  She works every day, an average of ten hours daily, and believes she is doing well because of her hard work and kindness to others.

Esther is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to rebuild one of the walls of her home.  It is currently in disrepair and needs to be reinforced.  This will mean more safety and well-being for Esther and her family, allowing her to continue working toward her goal of having her own bakery.

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Melvin Ricardo

texts.es: melvin de 38 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador vive en casa propia con su familia se dedica a ser agricultora siembra los principales granos basicos maíz y frijol almacena sus cosechas en los graneros que muestra en la fotografia para luego ir a venderlos a los diferentes mercados de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, melvin desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así podra seguir llevando el pan de cada dia a su familia y cubrir las necesidadse que se le presentan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Melvin, 38, is a very responsible, hard-working man who lives in his own house with his family.  He is a crop farmer and grows mainly corn and beans which he stores in the graneries shown in the photograph.  He then sells the grain to different markets near his place of residence.  

Melvin wants to increase his sales and is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.  He is counting on this support since he has no other means of income.  This will allow him to put food on the table for his family and cover their needs without limitation.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is a small-scale chop bar operator (where a variety of African dishes are sold)  in Hotopo near Takoradi. She has some formal education as a junior high school level graduate. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a driver. Vida has been working as a food vendor for close to 10 years. As a major provider in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of food stuffs and other ingredients, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of starting a food stand business to help her sell from a fixed location in the future

loans.use: to buy an increased quantity of food stuffs and other ingredients her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Busime Group

texts.fr: La cliente Margerite est présidente adjointe du groupe d’affaire Busime,  entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui ont déjà leurs foyers. Son conjoint est un cultivateur. La cliente est vendeuse des poissons et autres denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses produits devant son domicile. Elle commença ces affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu par son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le crédit de Hekima.  Il y a 20 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 60 poissons, 12 kg de fretins, 2 bidons d’huile de palme, etc.  Elle souhaite accroitre son capital. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit pour autonomiser les femmes entrepreneurs. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés, et que la photo fus prise précipitamment lors de braillards, quand une forte pluie menacée de tomber dans ce village de Kavumu.
texts.en:
This client, Margerite, is the vice-president of the business group Busime. An experienced entrepreneur, she is 50 years old, married, and the mother of four children, who already have their own households. This client sells fish and other food items. She sets up her products in front of her home. She started this business with her own funds gotten from her husband. Later on, she benefited from Hekima loans. She has been in this business for twenty years.

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 60 kg of fish, 12 kg of young fish, 2 containers of palm oil, etc. She would like to grow her capital. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-loans supporting women entrepreneurs to be autonomous. 

It should be noted that certain clients in the photo are carrying their babies and that the photo was taken in a hurry during a lot of yelling, since a rainstorm was threatening the village of Kavumu.

loans.use: to purchase fish, young fish, palm oil, etc.

loans.name: Maria Emelia

texts.en:
Maria Emilia is a 53-year-old married woman with three children from the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her community. 
Maria Emilia is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, rice, biscuits, candies, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and income.In the future. Maria Emilia hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, rice, biscuits, candies, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Leticia Marisol

texts.es:
Leticia es una mujer de 20 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Leticia se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Seco de Res para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Leticia trabaja como obrera de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Leticia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de una habitación en su vivienda, ya que esta actualmente está deteriorada y requiere de refacciones, de esta manera Leticia podrá y su familia podrá contar con un ambiente más adecuado y seguro, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Leticia is a 20-year old woman.  She is single and lives in the city of Chincha with her parents and siblings.  She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person, who has a great desire to get ahead.  

Thanks to her efforts and her parents' support, Leticia is currently studying for a professional degree in Business Management.  In her free moments, she likes to spend a little time reading and sometimes cooks a delicious Seco de Res [Peruvian beef dish] to share with her family.

By her own initiative, with a lot of determination and dedication, Leticia works as a field worker with an agricultural fund in her city.  She works every day for approximately 8 hours, and believes that it is going well for her because of her good performance and her friendly manner towards others.

Leticia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the assistance provided, she will be able to make improvements to a room in her home that is currently deteriorated and in need of updating.  In this way, Leticia and her family will be able to have a more adequate and secure environment, and she will continue to work and strive to achieve her great dream of becoming a good professional.

loans.use: to make improvements to a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for cakes, snacks, drinks and Tupperware for cake storage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, iron, blocks and gravel.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is married and has three children. They reside in Kisii. He has been in the farming business for 12 years, producing bananas, maize, and milk. Besides farming, he is a teacher.

He has requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo of KES. 62,400 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This will boost his income because there will be an increase in milk production. He expects high yields and improved productivity. He has a major challenge of lack of a stable local market for his products.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Chidanga

texts.en:
Chidanga is a married man with school-going children. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past three years, he has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in his place of operation. 

With the loan that he is requesting, he wants to buy bags of wheat flour, rice, sugar, cooking fat and maize flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy bags of wheat flour, rice, sugar, cooking fat and maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients and equipment.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 47-year-old married man and father of five children. He has been working in the transportation business for 20 years, to make sure his family has a good standard of living. In 2011, he started his own business, bought a bus of his own, and started providing this service.

Anwar works as an accountant, too, as an additional income business to make sure he is capable of properly meeting his family's needs.

Anwar's business is improving since his customers are recommending him to others because of the trust they have towards him and because of his good reputation. That's why he bought another bus, to accommodate the increased number of students requesting his service. To provide this service properly, Anwar has to register the new bus, and start working on it. In this way, he can serve new customers and provide someone he trusts with a new job as a bus driver.
 
He applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for legal registration fees.

loans.use: to register a new bus.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames, les quatre  femmes du groupe Badenya ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes au quartier Darsalam de Ségou dans la 4ème Région administrative du Mali. Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Médine Ségou. Elles font l’achat et la vente des habits pour enfants, du poisson et des céréales.
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme assise sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente d’habits pour enfants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 40 complets d’habits pour enfants au grand marché de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant, à crédit à domicile et au marché Médine à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in monogamous families, the four women of the group Badenya average 36 years of age and three children each. The women all live in the Darsalam district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their revenue-generating businesses at the Médine Ségou market. They buy and sell children's clothing, fish, and grains.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, they group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Mariam (seated in the photo) has a great reputation in the selling of children's clothing. She intends to use her loan to purchase 40 children's outfits at the big market of Ségou. Sales are made, cash or credit, at home and at the Médine market to a customer base composed mostly of women.

With this loan, Ms. Mariam plans on making an average monthly profit of 37,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and caring for the children at home.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en: Ezra is a hardworking man with three children. They live in Fort Portal, Uganda. For 17 years he has been growing coffee, and it has been very lucrative. He also buys from others in order to meet the high demand. With the profits he has been able to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to see them attain degrees as minimum qualification. Stiff competition and unpredictable weather changes affect the business. His dream is to own a coffee store that can supply his customers all year round. Ezra is requesting a loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en: Ma. Cecilia is a fish vendor from Loon, Bohol. She is a married woman and mother of three school-aged children. Ma. Cecilia is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. With this, she will be able to increase her sales, thus augmenting her income. In the future, Ma. Cecilia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ada Luz

texts.es:
Ada es una mujer de 38 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta limpiar su hogar y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Sopa de Leche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ada trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, ella ocupa un pequeño espacio en su vivienda y puede trabajar por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Ada se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de mercadería, como gaseosas, refrescos, agua mineral, arroz, golosinas, menestras y otros, de esta manera Ada tendrá mejor abastecido su negocio y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una casa segura que brinde mayor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Ada, 38, lives in the city of Pisco with her two small children, who she loves very much and are her main reason for living.  She is a very kind, hard-working, enthusiastic person who dedicates all her efforts to providing for her family, since she is both mother and father to her children.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resouces and out of necessity, she had to start work at a very young age.  She was unable to get a degree in Business Administration as she would have liked.  In her free time she enjoys cleaning house and sometimes cooks a delicious "Sopa de Leche" (chicken stew) to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much tenacity and dedication, Ada works in her small store selling groceries and beverages.  The store occupies a small space in her home and she works about 10 hours a day.  She believes business is going well because of her low prices and kindness to customers.

Ada is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks their help she can buy larger volumes and variety of merchandise, such as sodas, soft drinks, mineral water, rice, sweets, instant soups, etc.  This means her store will be better stocked to serve customers and she will be able to continue working toward her goal of having a more stable home and a better lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   TIESSIRI  est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier MASSABLACOURA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’ habillements à l’image de  MAMOU,qui est la première femme de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente d’habillements et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 25 pagnes avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group TIESSIRI comprises four women, all married and averaging 32 years of age and five children each. The women live in traditional extended families with their husband, co-wives, brothers, and sons in the MASSABLACOURA district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to operate their businesses better, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth loan. The four previous loans were correctly repaid.

This group of women does commerce in clothing, as does MAMOU, who is the first woman on the right in the photo. She buys and sells grains and intends to use her loan to purchase 25 lengths of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) from Bamako wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales retail at the market and at home to a customer base composed essentially of women. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 22,000 francs CFA that will be reinvested in her work and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
This is Elisa, 38, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Agustin, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Elisa operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of time and money to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and meals costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy more products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Elisa dreams that her business will continue to grow and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Sanobar

texts.en:
Sanobar is 50 years old. She and her husband are kind people and have four children. She is very hardworking and kind-natured. 

Sanobar has been farming for 20 years, producing wheat and animal feed. She earns additional income from animal husbandry. Currently she has 13 sheep. She also graduated Medical College and works at the local hospital as a nurse. She loves to work a lot and that’s why she manages so well with all her responsibilities. In order to provide her crops with the needed nutrition, Sanobar is currently requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 USD so that she can buy fertilizer and continue improving her crop production. She hopes to generate more income and take advantage of the high prices being commanded on an international level so that she can achieve a better standard of living and help her children continue their education.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers for the land where she grows wheat and feed for cattle.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: This marks Jane's fourth loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous ones successfully. She will purchase additional retail inventory of sugar, rice, cooking oil, and tea leaves for her shop. She hopes to continue running her business successfully and to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, cooking oil, and tea leaves.

loans.name: 08-Pt3-08-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Hà is the group leader of the 08-PT3-08-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Hà is 34 years old and is married with two children.

Mrs. Hà operates a food stall/restaurant selling beverages. She has been involved in this business for four years. She is requesting a loan to purchase sugar cane to make drinks to sell. 

This is Hà's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main harship Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to buy land of her own, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: To purchase sugar cane to make drinks to sell.

loans.name: Paso Del Río Group 2

texts.en:
Apolonia and Susana live in a small community on the Veracruz Coast. They both have a small food business that attends the local population, mainly on weekends and vacations. They do not have electricity in their business, which limits their working hours. 

Apolonia is a proud 47 year old Mexican that works as a cook. She lives with her husband and her two parents in law in the community of Paso del Río, located in the state of Veracruz. For the last 6 years, besides being in charge of maintaining her household and taking care of her loved family, Apolonia has worked selling her delicious Mexican food in a Palapa (an open-sided beach front restaurant made from dry palm leaves) in order to contribute to her home income and her family needs. Even though her Palapa has no electric grid access, Apolonia start´s working from sunrise to sunset, only closing her business as the last costumer lives satisfied. 

Apolonia uses candles to light her Palapa, but the bad lighting quality does not allow Apolonia  to cook after daylight. Also, the smoke that the candles emit bothers her customers, sometimes driving them away form her food business. Nevertheless, Apolonia has a plan: To buy solar home system that will allow her to have quality lighting in her Palapa and to cook during night hours, in order to appeal even more customers.

loans.use: purchase a solar home system that will increase their food business productivity.

loans.name: Hueytamalco Group

texts.en:
Martin and Jaime are both hardworking farmers from the small marginalized community of Conta, very near to the border of Puebla with the state of Veracruz. They have each requested to purchase a solar home system to save on hazardous lighting sources and improve their families living conditions. Here is Martín's story: 

Martín is 37 years old from the municipality of Hueytamalco, in the state of Puebla. Since he can remember, Martín has worked every single day as a farmer. Since he became a father 10 years ago, Martín works even harder to bring a better life quality to his wife and two children. His job as a peasant allows him to earn $228 USD a month, which he distributes to the maintenance of his home, the care of his family and the education of his children, whom he has taught to love agriculture but also to work on their school tasks. 

Martín´s home does not have grid access, however he has tried to improve this situation by lighting their home with candles, but the bad light quality cannot allow their children to extend their education hours and exposes them to breathing hazardous smoke. Additionally, this represents an important cost in his limited budget. Martín wishes to provide his family a better life quality, that’s why he´s planning to buy a solar home system that will allow his children to have more hours of study, improving their education in the general aspect. Martín and his wife will use their new  solar home system to extend their productivity and enjoy family time.

loans.use: acquire a solar home system that will let his family extend their productive hours a day.

loans.name: Mzungu

texts.en:
Mzungu is a married man. He and his wife have two children, one of whom attends school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, he has operated a business selling coconuts, selling to local neighbors. He faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation in the business. Mzungu dreams of establishing a vegetable stall in the future.

With the 10,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Paso Del Río Group

texts.en:
Ernestina, together with José and Nadialy, live in Tecolutla, Veracruz in a small rural community called Paso del Río. They are interested in purchasing a solar home system on credit. This is Ernestinas story:

Ernestina is 44 years old and lives in Paso del Río, in the state of Veracruz, with her beloved husband and her two parents. During her childhood, Ernestina was in charge of the household tasks. As a teenager she worked cooking and helping with the home activities of her neighbors, so she could contribute to her own household expenses.  Ernestina´s household has no access to the electric grid and that is why she must do her household tasks whilst there is still daylight. During the night she uses candles to do other activities. 

For 20 years Ernestina has been devoted to the caring of one single household along with her husband. Her husband whose job as a fisherman provides the only family income, however, his salary is not stable because it depends on market demand.

Ernestina wants to contribute to her household expenses and work as hard as her husband by cooking food and selling it to other fishermen. To achieve this, Ernestina wishes to buy a solar home system that will bring lighting to her home and will allow her to extend productivity hours every day, so she will be able to help her household tasks during the day and cook at night, additionally, this will allow her to spend time with her loving family.

loans.use: purchase a solar home system that provides lighting for their homes.

loans.name: Edgar Meliton

texts.es:
El señor Edgar de 38 años de edad esta casado con la señora Silvia con quien tiene dos hijos de pequeña edad el mayor tiene 8 años de edad y estudia la primaria y la más pequeña de tan solo 5 años de edad estudiando el preescolar, son a los que quieren darles lo mejor y que tengan un futuro emprendedor.
Están solicitando un crédito KIVA para realizar una mejora en su vivienda, ya que le esta haciendo falta la barda alrededor de su casa y no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Con el sueldo que recibe el señor Edgar como guardia planean pagar el crédito y su esposa la señora Silvia se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares con el  ingreso que recibe de su empleo.
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y que tengan un lugar seguro donde vivir, ya que sus hijos son pequeños y les gusta salir a jugar.
texts.en:
Thirty-eight year old Edgar is married to Silvia, with whom he has two young children.  The older one is 8 years old and is in primary school, and the younger is only 5 years old and in preschool.  They want to give them the best so that they can have an enterprising future.

They are applying for a Kiva loan in order to improve their housing, since it is lacking a wall around the house, and they don't have the necessary money to be able to buy the material and pay someone to build it.

With the salary that Edgar receives as a guard, they plan to repay the loan, and his wife will be responsible for family and school expenses with the income she receives from her job.

They want to improve the quality of life for their family, so that they have a safe place to live, since his children are young and like to go outside to play.

loans.use: to build a wall around his home.

loans.name: Lynatte

texts.en: Lynatte is applying for her second loan after repaying her first one successfully. She will use this new loan to buy dry food stocks, including cooking fat, bales of wheat and maize flour, milk and sugar for her food kiosk. Her expanded business is doing well and she hopes it will grow as big as the other businesses in her area.

loans.use: to buy new chairs, tables and serving dishes.

loans.name: 08-Ts3-13-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mận is 28 years old and is married with no children. She has a service business providing makeup sessions; she has been in this business for four years. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to do makeup sessions.

Mận is the group leader of the 08-TS3-13-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of eight members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She has no dependents.

This is Mận's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main harship that Mận faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Mận hopes for her family to be healthy and happy; she wishes to buy land of her own, and for her business to do well. She hopes the profit from her business will help her achieve these goals.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to do makeup sessions.

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale owns a house that has neither electricity nor running water. His largest monthly expense is food for his family.

For the past five years, Mangale has operated a business selling food products in his stall and selling at the market to local neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality and high transportation costs in his place of operation. 

With the loan that he is requesting, he wants to purchase bags of rice, sugar, salt, and wheat flour for resale. He decided to join Yehu in order to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, sugar, salt, and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Amani Group

texts.fr: La cliente M'fundi est présidente et doyenne du groupe Amani, entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 52 ans, mariée et mère de 14 enfants, parmi les quels il ya des majeurs qui ont déjà leurs ménages. Son conjoint est un chômeur.  La cliente est vendeuse de haricots au marché de Kavumu. Depuis son jeune âge, elle exerce cette activité. Tous ses enfants étudient. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 8 sacs de haricots. Elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise et construire une jolie maison. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.Il sied de signaler qu’une cliente tient son enfant.
texts.en:
This client, M'fundi, is the president and most senior member of the group Amani. An energetic entrepreneur, she is 52 years old, married, and the mother of fourteen children, of whom some are adults with their own households already. Her husband is unemployed. This client sells beans at the Kavumu market. She has been in this business since she was young. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 8 sacks of beans. She would like to expand her enterprise and build a nice house. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-loan support. It should be noted that one client in the photo is holding her child.

loans.use: to purchase beans

loans.name: Rhuhekekuguma Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nzige est présidente du groupe de crédit Rhuhekekuguma, entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Son conjoint est un taxi-man.  La cliente est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires au marché de Kavumu. Depuis son jeune âge, elle exerce cette activité. Tous ses enfants étudient. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 bidons d’huile de palme, 3 sacs de sucres, 12 sacs de riz, etc. Elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise et construire une jolie maison. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.
texts.en:
This client, Nzige, is the president of the loan group Rhuhekekuguma. An energetic entrepreneur, she is 34 years old, married, and the mother of eight children. Her husband is taxi driver. This client sells grocery items at the Kavumu market. She has been in this business since she was young. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 3 containers of palm oil, 3 sacks of sugar, 12 sacks of rice, etc. She would like to expand her enterprise and build a nice house. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its micro-loan support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
This is Analiza, 33, resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Limo and a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Analiza runs an “ukay-ukay” business. “Ukay” literally means to “dig out” or “hollow out” from a stack or heap of anything. In Analiza's case, she is selling used (but not yet worn out) clothes that are usually stacked up on a table or mat. Some special kinds are displayed on hangers. In the Philippines, especially in poor urban communities, many people resort to buying used clothes from “ukay-ukay” stalls. These are much cheaper compared with brand new clothes sold in malls. Since her stall is located in a public market in a poor, urban area, her business flourishes. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) net sales every day. 

To help her expand the business, she is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy additional stock of used-but-quality clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from an “ukay-ukay” stall with lots of clothes to choose from. She plans to add more pants or jeans, as well as used bags and footwear. If she can reinvest the profits from this loan, she can meet the customers’ demand. Through proper management of capital and profit, she can expand her business and boost its income.

Analiza dreams that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of quality used clothes needed in her business.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 55 years old and lives in the New Kru Town area of Montserrado County. He is married. He was unfortunate to have attended only grade school, but he learned other trades by which he is surviving. His wife is a business woman and they have four children between the ages of 2 and 28, who are presently attending school. Two attend university while the younger ones attend grade school.

For the past 20 years, Mohammed has been running a shop where he fixes and sells items like cooking pots, cooking spoons, frying pans, etc. He makes a lot of profit since he is the only one who is involved in this business in his area. Some of the problems he facing are that he has less income and the cost of aluminum is very high. He is requesting a loan to purchase more aluminum to fix more cooking pots, cooking spoons, frying pans, etc., for his business. He plans to build a house for his children in the years to come and give them a university education.

loans.use: to purchase more aluminum to fix more cooking pots, cooking spoons, frying pans, etc., for his business.

loans.name: Tetee S.

texts.en:
Tetee S. has been running a shop where she sells many items likes trousers, shirts, blouses, etc., in the area of Buchanan, where she lives with her two children. She is single, and her education ended at 8th grade, but she said she is very good at managing her business. She spends ten hours, six days a week with her business and her business is very supportive to her family and relatives. She is able to make daily expenditures, send her children to school, and bought a spot to build another shop in the near future. She started this business in 2007, when she found herself as a high school dropout. 

Tetee S. is 30 years old, and she is requesting a loan to buy more clothing for her business. Her dream is to see herself as an international businesswoman and to educate her two children.

loans.use: to buy more trousers, shirts, blouses, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Haby's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de femmes fait parti du Banc Villageois de Kambeng Doumassou qui a été inauguré le 15 Novembre  2006.

Le groupe est composé de femmes très expérimentées dans le programme ainsi que de quelles que nouvelles venues. Elles sont toutes très actives dans leur activité : le petit commerce. 
Elles habitent toutes le même quartier, ce qui favorise une  bonne entente et une grande solidarité dans le groupe.

Haby (debout au fond à droite levant la main, en boubou bleu ciel), est la représentante du groupe. 
Mariée et mère d’une fille et de cinq garçons, elle est vendeuse d’articles vestimentaires, notamment des chaussures pour femmes de fabrication locale et des tissus wax.
Elle achète sa marchandise à la capitale pour la revendre dans son village à crédit payable en deux mensualités.
    
Pour ce nouveau prêt elle compte s’approvisionner uniquement en tissus wax en coupon de 60 yards qu’elle revendra à 1 000 FCFA le yard.

Avec les bénéfices, elle désire constituer une épargne assez importante en vue de bénéficier d’un crédit beaucoup plus important pour agrandir son commerce et améliorer la prise en charge ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group of women is part of the Banc Villageois of Kambeng Doumassou, which was inaugurated on November 15, 2006.

The group is composed of highly experienced women in the program, as well as some who are newly arrived. The women are all very active in their work: small-scale commerce. They all live in the same district, and this favors good relations and great solidarity in the group.

Haby (standing in the back at the right with her hand raised and wearing a sky-clue 'boubou') is the group's representative. She is married and the mother of a girl and five boys. She sells clothing, especially wax cloth and women's shoes made locally. She purchases her goods in the capital and then resells them in her village on credit, payable in two monthly payments. 

For this new loan, she intends to stock up on just wax cloth in 60-yard lengths that she will resell at 1,000 francs CFA per yard.

With the profits, she would like to build up her savings enough to benefit from a much larger loan, so as to expand her business and do better in caring for her children.

loans.use: to stock up on fabrics to resell in her village

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is a 25-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has two children. The oldest child is 8 years old and the youngest is 6 years old. Gemma is engaged in rice farming. She has been growing rice for three years. His husband operates a motorcycle transport service. To sustain her farming business, Gemma requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy fertilizer, as well as be able to pay monthly fees for the motorcycle. In the future, Gemma would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm and to pay monthly fees for a motorcycle for her husband's motorcycle transport service.

loans.name: Willis Otieno

texts.en:
Willis is 39 years old and he is from Coner Mbuta in Manyatta location within Kisumu city, which is found in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Rehema and they have four children who are 13, 11, nine and seven years old.

Willis has a retail shop that he has made to be a wholesale store. This business has been running for the past 12 years and comfortably generates a monthly income of KES. 40,000. He has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to open a new milk center, where he wants to be a supplier in the area. He will use the anticipated profit to put back into the business.

He has a dream of having a stable wholesale shop so as to earn more income, which will help him provide for his family.

loans.use: to deposit money with a milk supplier.

loans.name: Ely

texts.en: Ely is a fish vendor from Maribojoc, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four children. Ely is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. Through this loan, Ely will be able to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Ely hopes of making her business successful and more sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rhudosanye Group

texts.fr: La cliente Malekera est présidente adjointe du groupe Rhudosanye, entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 50 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants. Son conjoint est un chômeur.  La cliente est vendeuse des poissons. Depuis son jeune âge, elle exerce cette activité. Elle expose ses produits au marché de Kavumu. Parmi ses 9 enfants, il ya des majeurs, qui ont déjà leurs familles et d’autres qui étudient encore. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 75 poissons. Elle souhaite agrandir son entreprise et construire un grand entrepôt agricole. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit.
texts.en:
This client, Malekera, is the vice-president of the group Rhudosanye. An energetic entrepreneur, she is 50 years old, married, and the mother of nine children. Her husband is unemployed. This client sells fish. She has been in this business since she was young. She displays her goods at the Kavumu market. Among her nine children, some are adults who already have their own families, while others are still students.

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 75 fish. She would like to expand her enterprise and build a large agricultural warehouse. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its micro-loan support.

loans.use: to purchase fish

loans.name: 03.01.59 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sáp operates a business raising poultry and cattle. Sáp is 52 years old and married with three children. Sáp lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her children are grown up. Sáp has been involved in the livestock business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future. 

Sáp is the group leader of the 03.01.59-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of eight members. 


In 2011, Sáp joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Sáp has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harship that Sáp faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Sáp hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well. She hopes the profits from her business will bring her closer to these dreams.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and eventually sell.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
Harrison is a married man and has ten children, all of whom left school because the family could not afford their school fees. Harrison owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His largest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Harrison has operated a business buying goats and selling them for meat at the market, to local neighbors and butcher operators. He faces major challenges of seasonality and high transportation costs in his place of operation. 

With the loan that he is requesting, he wants to purchase five goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase five goats for resale.

loans.name: Mriphe

texts.en:
Mriphe is a married man and has been blessed with three children. One attends school, while the other two are still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For the past three years, he has operated a retail business, selling household consumables to local customers. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the 30,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour, and soft drinks

loans.name: Ngawo's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc Villageois a été créé le 29/08/2003.le groupe est composé de 7 femmes qui habitent le même village,leur activité principal est le commerce.
   Ngawo est la représentante du groupe,âgée de 39 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 filles. 4 de ses enfants sont majeurs et un scolarisé. Elle est assise au milieu de la photo.
  Elle achète son pain chez son fournisseur  en ville pour vendre au village et à la gare routière. La boulangerie étant a 3 Km de son village, elle offre ainsi un service de proximité a sa clientèle. Le pain acheté s'appelle "tapalapa" et est facile a conserver.
Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 14 sacs de pain a 100 000francs CFA,  4 moutons a 100 000francs CFA et 50 000francs CFA d’aliment de bétail.
Avec ses bénéfices elle épargne dans le banc villageois et se prend toute seul en charge.
Elle paie aussi la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en:
This 'banc villageois' was created on November 29, 2003. The group comprises seven women who live in the same village. Their main work involves commerce. Ngawo is the group's representative. She is 39 years old, a widow, and the mother of six children, including three girls. Four of her children are adults and one is in school. Ngawo is the one sitting in the middle of the photo.

Ngawo purchases her bread from suppliers in town and then resells the goods in the village and at the bus station. Since the bakery is 3 km from her village, she offers a local service to her customers. The bread she purchases is called 'tapalapa' and is easy to keep. 

With her loan, she intends to purchase 14 sacks of bread at 100,000 francs CFA, 4 head of sheep at 100,000 francs, and some animal feed at 50,000 francs. With the profits, she adds to her saving at the 'banc villageois' and supports herself without help. She also covers her child's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase bread, sheep, and animal feed

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of two grown children. She is from Maribojoc, Bohol. Lenita has been engaged in the photo framing business for more than 13 years now.

Lenita is asking for a loan to buy glass, wood and moldings, mat, and other supplies for her business. With this, she will be able to serve more customers, thus augmenting her earnings and income. In the future, Lenita hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy glass, wood and moldings, mats, etc.

loans.name: Fatu S.

texts.en:
Fatu S. is 46 years old and lives in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia; it is well-known in Liberia. She is married and has four children, aged between 12 and 27, who are presently in school and live at home. She was unable to attend school.

For the past 10 years, she has been running a shop where she sells fashion cloth. She joined into business because she was unfortunate to not attend school. She started this business by selling on a market table, which lead to fashion cloth, and she learned this way of selling from her friends. She is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profit and it keeps her busy. Most interestingly, she learned those different kinds of local languages. She is requesting a loan to buy more fashion cloth to increase her business. Her plans are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more fashion cloth to increase her business.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
This marks Benjamin's third loan to finance his expanded baking business. He has requested the current loan in order to buy baking trays for use in his business. 

With his previous loan, Benjamin opened a sub-branch which specializes on baking cookies exclusively; he has done great and has a large clientele. He has a vision of owning a full-fledged bakery in the future.

loans.use: to purchase baking trays.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie raises hogs within her local community. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than five years. She is thankful because, through the income she has earned from this, she has been able to sustain her family's needs.

Rosie would like to improve her way of life, obtain better income, and have a stable source of income someday. To make this goal possible, she is requesting a loan of 25,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) which will allow her to buy necessary livestock feed and vitamins for her hogs. She knows that this loan amount would greatly help her in keeping her business productive and profitable. Rosie hopes and prays for the approval of her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: Abdusalim

texts.ru: Абдусалим доброжелательный мужчина в возрасте 60 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих взрослых детей. Дети Абдусалима со своими семьями живут в их доме в маленькой деревушке, поэтому  можно сказать, что у них большая и дружная семья.   Все вместе они стараются работать, чтобы приносить доход в свою большую семью. Жена Абдусалима работает в Дехканском хозяйстве, а старший сын работает строителем в России и получает стабильный ежемесячный доход, который посылает своей семье. Сам Абдусалим занимается откармливанием мелкого рогатого скота. Этим делом он занимается с молодости и имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. Но также его основной  профессией является вождение грузовой машины. Водителем  он работает уже 30 лет. Работая водителем грузовой машины он также получает дополнительный доход.  Абдусалим мечтает о том, чтобы его дети и внуки всегда жили в достатке, поэтому работает не покладая рук. Сейчас он планирует строить дом для своего старшего сына, где он будет жить со своей семьёй. Но для этого необходима большая сумма денег, поэтому Абдусалим хочет взять кредит для за купа мелко рогатого скота, чтобы расширить свой бизнес. Ему нужно сейчас закупить больше рогатого скота, чтобы он смог в будущем их продать и получить хороший доход. Он надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарен Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Abdusalim is a kind, 60 year-old man.  He is married and has two adult children.  Abdusalim's children and their families live in their house in a small village, and this is why it can be said that they have a big and friendly family.  All of them try to work together to earn income for their big family.  Abdusalim's wife works at a dekhan farm, and the oldest son works as a construction worker in Russia and earns a stable monthly income, which he sends to his family.  Abdusalim is involved in fattening up small livestock.  He has been involved in this type of business since his youth and has an extensive experience in this field.  But also his main profession is driving a truck.  He has been working as a driver for 30 years.  He also earns an additional income working as a truck driver.  Abdusalim dreams that his children and grandchildren lived with plenitude and this is why he works without putting his hands down.  Now he plans to build a house for his oldest son, where he would live with his family.  But this requires a large sum of money, and this is why Abdusalim wants to obtain a loan to buy small livestock in order to expand his business.  He needs to buy more livestock now, so that he could sell it in the future and make a good profit.  He hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Chris

texts.en:
Chris is 36 years old and lives in New Kru Town of the early community, which is well-known in Liberia. He is married and is a university student; his wife  works as a teller in a bank, and they have a four-year-old child who is presently attending school. 

For the past four years Chris has been selling spare parts for engine repairs, generators, cars, and motorcycles. He does good business, since he is the only one in his community who is involved in this business and he sells quality products. Still, his income is small enough to be a challenge. He is requesting a loan to purchase more engine repair parts, generator parts, and car and motorcycle parts for his business. He plans to educate his children and build a house for them in the years to come.

loans.use: to purchase more engine repair parts, generator parts, car parts, and motorcycle parts for his business.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.en:
Gregorio is a 33-year-old married man from Anda, Bohol. He has two children, ages 5 and 3. He raises pigs. He has been in this business for more than five years. His wife works as a waitress. 

Gregorio has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy additional piglets and feed, in order to increase his number of livestock and for the pigs to grow healthy, so that he can sell them on time. He would like to expand his piggery business to support his family and at the same time save for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Waldo

texts.en:
Chef Waldo had a dream and $146. His dream was to feed people – many people.

"First comes the dream, then the idea," he says. "Then the dream can come true."

Waldo opened two businesses: Divine Taste Catering, and restaurant, El Ceviche De Waldito. He says cooking is his calling and he uses his mind, heart and talents to satisfy customers with his authentic Peruvian and Caribbean dishes.

Born in Peru, Waldo attended a culinary arts school before moving to Miami, where he studied business hospitality before moving to San Antonio.

Following his dream, 50-year-old Waldo did everything he could to make the most of his funds. He says when a person has less than $200, "This is the time you use your brain; this is the time you use your heart and say, 'Yes I can.'"

With no vehicle, he and his wife walked to H-E-B, a Texas grocer, for food. They searched trashcans for valuables like chairs and tables they later cleaned and tightened for use in the restaurant.

After learning about Accion Texas Inc. at a function for small businesses, Waldo applied and was approved for a loan he's using to build his credit.

Excellent credit history and scores are judgments of a person's future ability to make large purchases, such as when purchasing any type of vehicle or home. If a person has great credit, they seem more likely to repay on-time, and are more likely eligible for a line of credit to make large purchases.

Waldo says, "When you see the opportunity, don't let it go. It's yours, don't let it go."

He says, "Accion Texas is like part of the dream come true. I feel covered, I feel like, behind me, there's someone holding my head and my arms named Accion. I don't feel alone."

A religious man, Waldo never worried if his business would be successful because he says, "If one is good in life, they'll be rewarded."

After two years, he has four employees, four cars and a restaurant where he's served Spanish singer-songwriter Julio Iglesias, President Clinton and Vice President Gore, Mayor Julian, his twin brother, Joaquin, who is a U.S. House Representative, hotel chefs, as well as members of the community.

"I'm not small. I'm a big guy. Maybe if you see me, I'm a short guy, but I have a big heart," he says adding, "I say, God, thank you for giving me this experience."

When he can, Waldo says he likes to give back to the community, donating his culinary talents to causes. Now that he has a restaurant, he has new dreams to open a community center, start a scholarship fund for parents who think they are too old to return to school, and fundraise with his food to help pay medical bills for families with cancer-stricken children. But, Waldo says he is taking his dream one step at a time.

loans.use: to build credit, which is critical when purchasing shelter or transportation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes and accessories.

loans.name: Abdumajid

texts.ru: Абдумачид позитивный по жизни человек. У него очень хорошо развита фантазия, и он очень хорошо разбирается в скотоводстве. Ведь скотоводство его основной источник дохода. Поэтому Абдумачид большое время занят этим делом. Он каждый день выводит скот на пастбище. Чистит коровник, держит контроль над чистотой и здоровьем коров. Абдумачид специально для коров подготовил место, где они пасутся  днем. Он умело превратил бывший канал, где когда то проходила вода, на маленькое пастбище. Его дети уже взрослые и самостоятельно работают. Помогают отцу и матери материально. Но Абдумачид не привык сидеть сложа руки. У него свой скот, от которого находит свой доход. Жена доит корову и также зарабатывает продавая молоко. Абдумачид пользуясь сезоном хочет купить корову и корм. С надеждой обратился в МДО «Арванд» . Благодарить за помощь и доверие в предоставлении кредита.
texts.en: Abdumajid is a person with a positive life attitude.  He has a well-developed imagination and knows animal husbandry very well.  Animal husbandry is his primary source of income.  This is why Abdumajid spends the majority of his time being involved in this business.  He takes livestock out to pasture every day.  He cleans the cowshed and maintains control over the cleanliness and health of cows.  Abdumajid specifically prepared a place for cows, where they go to a pasture during the day.  He skillfully transformed a former canal that once had water into a small pasture.  Abdumajid's children are already grown and work on their own.  They help their father and mother financially.  But Abdumajid is not used to sitting put with his hands down.  He has his own livestock, from which he finds his own income.  His wife milks the cow and also earns money selling milk.  Abdumajid wants to take advantage of the season and buy a cow and feed.  He came to MDO Arvand with hope.  He is grateful for the help and trust in providing him with a loan.

loans.use: to buy сow and feed

loans.name: Tenneh

texts.en:
Tenneh lives in Bardnersville, one of the populated areas in Montsorrado County. She is 53 years old, single, and has three children between the ages of 14 and 27 years old. Two of her children are attending grade school, one is in college, and they all live at home. 

For the past ten years now, Tenneh has been operating a provisions shop where she sells tooth paste, milk, sardines, washing soap, rice, and many  other items.  She started this business with money that she received from her mother and she learned this ways of selling from her friends. Among the challenges she faces is the transporting of goods to her shop. Tenneh is requesting a loan to purchase more goods for her business. Her plans is to expand her business and earn a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as tooth paste, milk, sardines, washing soap, rice, and many other items for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widowed mother of three children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past the two years, Elizabeth has owned rental houses, tenants being her potential customers.  She dreams of expanding her rental houses to accommodate more tenants in the future.

With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase cement, sand, and iron sheets to add more rooms. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and iron sheets to add more rooms to her rental houses.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед молодой активный человек, который несмотря на свои годы очень хороший мастер. С детство ходил на ученики к мастеру – плотнику и изучал все тонкости этого дела. Постепенно он начал работать самостоятельно. Принимал заказы на дом. Своим трудом заработал денег, помогал родителям и женился. Теперь у Чамшеда  своя семья, но они живут с родителями вместе. Вот уже два года он работает в частном предприятии, которое изготавливает и устанавливает пластиковые окна. На сегодняшней день, у Чамшеда и его семьи появилось потребность на приобретение легковой автомашины, и  он хочет приобрести автомобиль, чтобы его родители и жена не затруднялись с транспортом. Чамшед на данный момент не имеет нужную сумму для покупки авто. От друзей узнал о кредитовании и обратился в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. Надеться на поддержку со стороны Арванд  и заранее благодарит за содействие.
texts.en: Jamshed is a young and active person, who, despite his age, is a good master.  He was an apprentice to a master carpenter since childhood and learned all of the nuances of this business.  Gradually, he started working independently.  He took orders at home.  He earned money with his work, helped his parents and got married.  Now Jamshed has his own family, but they live together with his parents.  He has been working at a private company that makes and installs plastic windows for two years.  Today, Jamshed and his family have a need to purchase a car and he wants to buy one, so that his parents and wife had no difficulties with transport.  Currently, Jamshed does not have the required sum of money to buy a car.  He learned from his friends about financing and came to MDO Arvand for a loan.  He hopes for support from Arvand and is grateful in advance for the assistance.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 57-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown children. She lives with her family in Maribojoc, Bohol. 

Elisa runs a sari-sari (variety) store business, a computer gaming venture, and a food business selling barbeque and other foods. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, rice, soap, toiletries, and meat. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and eventually her income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, rice, soap, toiletries, and meat

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman with two children.  She is an extremely hard-working lady. 

For 26 years, Rosemary has been farming watermelon, a business from which she has been able to support her family and pay the school fees for her children. Like most good mothers, her desire is to educate her children up to the university level, while her business plan is to farm extensively and also grow trees. Rosemary will use this loan to plant trees and more watermelon.

loans.use: to plant trees and more watermelon

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a middle-aged Cameroonian woman, who is married and has four children.Her oldest child is 18 years old and in a secondary school, and her youngest is 4 years old and in primary school. She lives in an urban area.

Beatrice has been in this business for the past four years, which makes her very stable, experienced, and successful. This is her very first loan from ACEP and Kiva. This loan will help her increase her output by about 30% and hence raise her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy tailoring related materials

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
This is Jesus. He previously accessed an 50,000 PHP loan that he used to purchase materials needed in his electronics repair shop. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. He will use the loan to buy materials needed in his electronics repair shop, such as wiring. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Jesus dreams that his business will continue to grow. He meets up with co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials such as wiring.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man and has been blessed with six children, three boys and two girls. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past the 10 years, he has operated a vegetable kiosk business, selling green vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. He sells primarily to local neighbors. Hamisi dreams of expanding and establishing a shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 loan, he wants to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes and tomatoes. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Masudi

texts.en:
Masudi is a recurring client of Yehu microfinance, applying for a second loan. He says thanks for the previous loan, with which he was able to expand his business and increase his monthly profits.

With this loan, he wants to construct his permanent home and plans to purchase iron sheets, timber, and nails and to pay labor charges. He dreams of establishing another business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets, timber, and nails and to pay labor charges.

loans.name: Sharifaoy

texts.ru:
Шарифаой добрая и трудолюбивая женщина.  К большому сожалению она несколько лет тому назад развелась с мужем и осталось с двумя сыновьями одна без опоры.   У Шарифаой 1 группа инвалидности, но  она жизнерадостная и любит своих сыновей  и жизнь.  Она ни где не работает, но получает пенсию.  Старший сын  Шарифаой работает в России, младший работает таксистом в их городке.  Они оба помогают матери. 
В настоящий момент она хочет построить дом, так как они живут в квартире, и на следующий год старший сын планирует жениться, и новой семье будет тесновато в их квартире. Для этого Шарифаой просит кредит для постройки нового дома, они очень надеются, что на следующий год будут жить в уютном доме.
На полученный кредит Шарифаой хочет купить строительные материалы и начать строить дом.  Она заранее  благодарит   "Арванд" за  возможность приобрести  свой дом.
texts.en:
Sharifaoy is a kind and hardworking woman. Most unfortunately, she divorced her husband a few years ago and was left alone with her two sons without support. Sharifaoy has a group 1 disability, but she is cheerful and loves her sons and life. She does not work, but she receives a pension. Sharifaoy's elder son works in Russia and the younger works as a taxi driver in their town. They both help their mother. 

At the moment, she wants to build a home because they live in an apartment and next year she is planning her elder son's wedding, and a new family will be cramped in their apartment. For this, Sharifaoy is asking for a loan for the construction of a new home. They are very hopeful that next year they will  live in a cozy house.

Sharifaoy wants to use the loan to buy building materials and to start building the house. She thanks Arvand in advance for the opportunity to purchase her own home.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Miguel está trabajando junto hace 12 ciclos, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron con el propósito de ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Tomasa, que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo ella se encuentra mejorando su vida, y la de su familia. Tomasa se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser jeans, remeras, vestidos y demás y por medio de este trabajo esta saliendo adelante y ayudar a los suyos. Cuenta que desde siempre ha trabajado y que no teme a ningún desafío.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de jeans, remeras, camisas, blusas  y demás para poder seguir innovando y dando buenos productos a sus clientes
texts.en:
The group called “San Miguel” has been working together for 12 cycles.  They are all female heads of household who joined together in order to help their families by means of their work.  One of the members is Tomasa who by means of her effort and work is improving her and her family’s lives.

Tomasa works selling all types of clothes like jeans, t-shirts, dresses and others and by means of this work is getting ahead and helping her loved ones.  She relates that she’s always worked and fears no challenge.  She’s asking for this loan to be able to invest in jeans, t-shirts, shirts, blouses and others to continue innovating and giving good products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian lives in Bardnersville, one of the populated areas in Montsorrado county. She is 29 years old and single with three children between the ages of 2 and 8.  All of her children are currently in school and live at home. Christian is a high school dropout, but she is good at managing her business. She says she is a hard-working and respectful person.

For the past two years, Christian has been running a shop where she sells building materials such as nails, cement, paint, paint-brushes, etc. She started this business with a little income from a friend and learned this way of selling from her friends. She says she enjoys her business because it has given her pride and she really enjoys interacting with her customers. One problem she is facing is a lack of some building materials that her customers always ask her for. Christian is requesting a loan to purchase more building materials (nails, cement, paint, paint-brushes, etc.), especially the ones she does not have at her shop. Her future plan is to expand her business and become an international investor.
