loans.use: to purchase more building materials (nails, cement, paint, paint-brushes, etc.), especially the ones she does not have at her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with six children, two of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She operates a business weaving mats, making table mats and door mats. In addition she also operates a farming business to earn income. She sells at the market to local neighbors and passers-by. 

With the 15,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase mat-weaving materials and seeds for her farming business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase mat-weaving materials and seeds

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 42 years old, married, and has two children.  She is from Maribojoc, Bohol. Cristina is engaged in fish selling business, which she has been doing for more than 10 years. 

Cristina is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy more fish to sell. With the loan, she will be able to sell more and earn more thus allowing her to meet some needs of the family such as  the purchase of food. In the future, Cristina dreams of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Eriya

texts.en: Eriya is a 49-year-old married man with four children, ages 6, 16, 20, and 26 years old, who resides in Hoima, Uganda. He operates a general store, mainly selling sodas and water both on a wholesale and a retail basis, which he started with savings from agriculture and loan capital. He started this business in order to improve the family's standard of living and develop it. He would like to expand on the existing  business, but late payments by customers and high transport costs are factors affecting his growth. Eriya intends to use the a loan to buy sodas and packed water to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and packed water for resale.

loans.name: Jesus Misericordioso Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Jesús Misericordioso está en su  ciclo número 2 del programa de comités, ellas están empezando a trabajar juntas, se están conociendo y tienen muchas ganas de salir adelante y ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La Sra. Graciela es una de las integrantes, ella tiene su pequeño negocio de una despensa y mercería en su casa, donde tiene todo tipo de productos que sus clientes necesitan. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de las capacitaciones ella pueda seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la ayuda y la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, verduras, carnes, frutas y demás para poder surtir bien su despensa y de esa forma seguir dando a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The group called “Jesús Misericordioso” (Merciful Jesus) is in its second cycle in the committees program.  They are starting to work together and getting to know one another; they very much want to get ahead and help each other out.

Graciela is one of the members.  She has a small variety and grocery store located at home where she stocks all sorts of products her customers need.  She’d like as time passes and with help from training to be able to continue growing like she’s been doing to date.  She is grateful for the support and opportunity she’s receiving.  She’s requesting this loan to buy beverages, dairy products, vegetables, meats, fruit and others to stock her store well thus continuing to give her customers what they need.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 33-year-old married man and father of four children. He has been working in the construction business for 11 years. In 2008, he started his own business to improve his family's living conditions and increase his income.

Maher specializes in cement work and is very talented in this domain. To improve his family's living and to make sure that his children have the best education, Maher is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to start another new business. He will buy an espresso machine in order to start selling coffee and hot drinks in his area.

Maher found a very good location to start his business, and he is very anxious to start it as soon as possible. He hopes to expand both businesses and improve his living.

loans.use: To start a new coffee shop business

loans.name: Telnaz

texts.en:
Telnaz is 43 years old. She lives in the Gardabani District with her daughter. Telnaz has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family start-up business, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected repeatedly, because of her family's low income and poor living conditions. 

Telnaz is involved in agricultural activities. She has a plot of agricultural land, where she grows different kinds of vegetables. She sells the harvested products at local markets. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Telnaz requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions for rural poor people, who do not have access to commercial credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With this loan, Telnaz will begin a clothing business. She plans to purchase clothing at wholesale prices and then resell it at higher prices. This will increase her income and she will be able to provide better living conditions for her daughter. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin a clothing business

loans.name: Omuhereza

texts.en: Omuhereza is a 41-year-old married man with eight children, who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been working in local brew distillation but also buying it from others for 12 years. He earns additional income from a retail shop dealing in general household items. Omuhereza started his business to take advantage of a vast and ready market available to him and has since reaped tangible benefits. His aim is earn more income in order to educate his children and build a permanent house, while his business plan is to expand his sugarcane farm to a large estate since he uses sugarcane as a raw material for his local brew. Omuhereza intends to use this loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Selvester

texts.en: Selvester is a 40-year-old married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His main business is milling produce like maize, soya beans and groundnuts. He has been in business for eight years. He started this business because small scale farmers in his area could not access better prices with unprocessed products in the urban center. He gets additional income from welding metals. He is faced with a problem of transporting his produce to the market and hopes to buy more milling machines to even pack maize to foreign markets. Selvester is requesting a loan to buy spare parts to repair his milling machine.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his milling machine.

loans.name: Bekmirzo

texts.ru: Бекмирзо жизнерадостный и порядочный мужчина в возрасте 49 лет, он женат и является многодетным отцом. У него 6 прекрасных детей. Двое его старших сыновей находятся на заработках в России, там они занимаются ремонтом квартир и получают хороший доход, который ежемесячно присылают своим родителям. Остальные дети ещё учатся в школе. Бекмирзо вместе со своей женой занимаются своим бизнесом, чтобы иметь доход для удовлетворения семейных нужд. Раньше Бекмирзо работал в колхозе, но там он получал маленькую зарплату, которая едва хватала на жизнь, поэтому он решил уйти с этой работы и заняться своим бизнесом. Он начал выращивать овощи и фрукты, а также заниматься откормом скота. Он арендовал небольшую площадь земли, и с каждым годом, получая хороший урожай, он увеличил  свою прибыль, и вскоре он купил эту землю. В этом году он посадил пшеницу, так как ее легче выращивать. Жена помогает Бекмирзо ухаживать за урожаем. Но основным делом является конечно откорм и продажа скота. Этот вид бизнеса приносит основной доход в его семью. Сейчас Бекмирзо планирует расширить свой бизнес и хочет купить скот для дальнейшего откорма, и  на этом участке он будет пасти свой скот. Накопленные им средства не достаточны для покупки скота, поэтому  он хочет получить кредит в Арванд для покупки скота и надеется  на поддержку.
texts.en:
Bekmirzo is a cheerful and decent man of 49. He is married and the father of many children. He has six beautiful children. His two eldest sons are working in Russia, where they repair apartments and get a good income that they send to their parents monthly. The remaining children are still in school. 

Bekmirzo and his wife are engaged in their own business in order to have the income to meet family needs. Previously, Bekmirzo worked on a collective farm, but there he received a small salary which was barely enough to live on. As a result, he decided to leave that job and to start his own business. He started growing vegetables and fruits, as well as fattening livestock. He rented a small plot of land and, getting a good harvest each year, increased his income, and soon purchased the land. 

This year, he planted wheat because it is easier to grow. Bekmirzo's wife helps to care for the crops. But the main activity is of course fattening and selling livestock. This kind of business brings the main income for his family. 

Bekmirzo now plans to expand his business and wants to buy livestock for further fattening, and he will graze the livestock on his plot of land. His accumulated funds are not enough for the purchase of livestock, so he wants to get a loan from Arvand and hopes for support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Po Yoayu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Po Yoayu está en su ciclo número 5to. Y con mucho esfuerzo está trabajando para ir mejorando cada una en sus labores. También hacen actividades en grupo para que de esa forma la comunicación entre ellas vaya mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gricelda, quien con mucho esfuerzo pudo dedicarse a la peluquería y cuenta que gracias a que hace muy buenos trabajos está saliendo adelante. Su clientela es la que se encarga de hacerle publicidad y con ello le está yendo muy bien. Es una persona que desde pequeña ha tenido que trabajar.
Solicita de este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de  tintes, enjuagues, shampoo, tijeras y otros insumos para poder seguir dando un excelente servicio a sus clientes, ya que esto le ayudará a seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called “Po Yoayu” is in cycle #5 and with much effort is working so each one of them can improve in her work.  They also carry out group activities so that communication among them will gradually improve.

One of the members is Gricelda who with much effort was able to go into barbering.  She relates that thanks to doing very good work she’s moving forward.  Her clientele is her source of publicity and she’s doing very well thanks to this.  She’s a person who has had to work since she was little.

She requests this loan to buy dyes, rinses, shampoo, scissors and other supplies to be able to continue giving excellent customer service since this will help her to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies and tools.

loans.name: Mohamad Khaled

texts.en:
Mohamad Khaled, a 53-year-old single man, has been selling food in his convenience store for three years now. He used to draw on textiles, but because he needed a daily source of income, he opened the store to make his living.

Mohamad Khaled is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to expand his merchandise with special spring/summer beverages; he will also buy special-offer products that will increase his income and develop his business.

Well-known in his region for his good reputation and special prices, Mohamad Khaled hopes to continue pleasing his customers and developing his enterprise.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise with special spring/summer beverages.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
For the past 6 years, Chari has operated a vegetable kiosk business, selling green vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. She sells primarily to local neighbors. Chari dreams of expanding and establishing a shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes and tomatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she thanks Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cabbages, onions, potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is 36 years old with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has a retail business where he sells foods like sugar, salt, rice and drinks like soda, and beer. He has been operating it for 7 years along a busy street. He obtains additional income from alcohol brewing and processing. He started his business to take advantage of the increasing population in urban centers that need food and drinks to get more income for educating her children. His dream is to build a permanent house from the proceeds. Patrick is requesting a loan to buy salt, sugar, rice and beer to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, rice and beer to sell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a single woman. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
Mwanakombo wants to establish a retail shop, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize, rice and sugar.
With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, beans and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en: Abundia is a 63-year-old woman from Ubay, Bohol. She is a widow who relies on her Sari-sari (variety) store for an income. In her store she sells detergent, canned goods, shampoo, purified water and seasoning. This business has existed for 30 years now. Abundia is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy gasoline, canned goods, detergent and rice for her store. This will help so Abundia will not run out of supply and be able to maximize her profit. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger store and a better income from her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, canned goods, detergent and rice.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en: Criselda is a 35-year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol and the mother of six children. Criselda has been engaged in fish vending for more than 15 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell. She is optimistic that this loan will help her increase her income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Mcwilliam Z.

texts.en:
Mcwilliam Z. is a 31-year-old university graduate and father of three children between four and eight years of age. For the past two years he has been running an internet cafe in the area of Bardnersville, well-known as one of the early communities in Liberia. Because he is the only one offering this service in the community, Mcwilliam Z. makes good profits which he uses to pay rent and internet fees, and to improve his saving account.

His primary business problem is the rainy season, which leads to slow browsing. He is now requesting a loan to purchase more computers for his business, and plans to expand by opening another branch in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more computers for his business.

loans.name: Kasasa Twegate Group

texts.en: Isiah is a 35-year-old married man with four children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a member of a village bank group where members guarantee one another to get a loan. His main business is buying and selling produce like maize, beans and groundnuts and he has been in business for three years. He started this business because small scale farmers could not afford to sell in urban places due to high cost and yet there was a ready market offering better prices. He gets additional income from goat rearing. He is faced with a problem of transporting his produce to the market due to high transport costs and hopes to buy his own means of transport. Isiah is requesting a loan to produce maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to produce maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret and her husband have four children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Their greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Margaret has operated a business selling coconuts wholesale to neighbors. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

Margaret decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With this Kshs 50,000 loan, she will purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Sangay

texts.en: Sangy is 35 years old and lives in Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County. She is divorced and has two children aged 16 and 20 years old. One is in college and the youngest one is in high school and they both live at home. She stopped her education at elementary school and for the past 16 years she has been running a shop where she sells clothes, hair, slippers, and lappa (traditional cloth). She started this business when she and her husband were living together. With the little money that she received from him she managed to establish her business. She learned this way of selling from her mother. She is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profits and it keeps her busy. Most interestingly she learned those different kinds of local languages. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothes, hair, slippers, and lappa (traditional cloth) to expand her business. Her plan is to increase her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, hair, slippers, and lappa (traditional cloth) to expand her business.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado KUÑA GUAPA está en su ciclo número 5º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.  Mediante la cooperación que todas hacen es que su grupo está creciendo mucho y eso les da muchas oportunidades.
Fidelina, una de las miembros, se dedica a hacer todo tipo de tortas y para todos los eventos. Se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, ya que sus tortas son una delicia para sus clientes y siempre le hacen bastantes pedidos. Ella comenta que siempre tuvo buena pasta para los pasteles y que gracias a esto le esta yendo muy bien, y quiere poder seguir con su trabajo, es por eso que solicita de este crédito.
Quiere invertirlo en la compra de harina, huevos, manteca, dulces, chantilly y demás insumos para seguir deleitando a sus clientes con sus riquísimos productos.
texts.en:
The group KUÑA GUAPA is on its 5th loan cycle. It is a group of women, who all work and support themselves. 

Through their co-operation, the group has grown a lot and gives them many opportunities.

Fidelina, one of the members makes all kinds of cake for various events. She has a good customer base, as her cakes are a delight for her customers and she always has plenty of orders. She comments that she has always earned good money from her cakes and that, thanks to this, it is going well and she wants to be able to continue working, which is why she is asking for this loan.

She wants to invest it by buying flour, eggs, butter, sweets, cream and other ingredients to continue delighting her customers with her delicious products.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter, sweets, cream and other ingredients for making cakes.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en: Vicky is a 37-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has three children. The youngest child is 5 years old and the oldest is 14 years old. Vicky is a rice farmer. She has been growing rice for three years. Her husband operates a motorcycle transport services business. With a little income, Vicky  requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay for motorcycle registration for her husband to be able to continue operate his transportation services. She would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for her children's education for bright future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her rice farm and to pay for motorcycle registration so her husband can continue his transport service.

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en: Edwina is a 59-year-old married woman and a mother of a grown up daughter from Maribojoc, Bohol. Edwina runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Edwina is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell like canned goods, rice, soda and beverages, soap and detergents. With this loan, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers, which will allow her to increase her sales and profit. In the future, Edwina hopes of making her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, rice, soda and beverages, soap and detergents.

loans.name: Monica's Group

texts.en:
Monica is 43 years old and single. She is the leader of this group, and they sell items like soft drinks, foodstuff, bowls, kid wears, jewelry and decorative materials. She sells the soft drinks and foodstuff. She needs 1,500 GHS to be able to buy more cassava, plantains, Malta Guinness, Sprite, Coca-Cola and other drinks. Monica has applied for a loan from Kiva partner ID-Ghana for the further improvement of her drinking bar business, so that she could attract customers and make more profit. She has been operating her business for the past eight years, and Monica is confident that the Kiva loan will help her make her business more profitable. 

This group includes Paulina, Doris, Mary and Gloria, and they need a total amount of 3,700 GHS to expand businesses.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, plantains, Malta Guinness, Sprite, Coca-Cola and other drinks.

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.ru:
Махмуд добросовестный и порядочный  мужчина в возрасте 41 года.  Он женат имеет двоих прекрасных детей.  Всю свою жизнь   Махмуд занимается животноводством. Он очень хорошо знает все преимущество  этого дела.   Дома у него имеется пять голов крупно рогатого скота, и две дойные коровы. За дойными коровами ухаживает его жена, она кормит и доит их.  Каждый день они получают 10 литров молока и жена Махмуда производит кисломолочные продукты и продает знакомым и соседям.  Дополнительно Махмуд занимается дехканством.  Но основной доход от откорма скота. Махмуд старается расширить свой бизнес и на полученный кредит хочет купить еще корову и корма для скота. 
Махмуд заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и содействие.
texts.en:
Mahmud is an honest and decent man of 41. He is married with two beautiful children. 

Throughout his life, Mahmud has been involved in animal husbandry. He knows very well all the advantages of this business. At home, he has five heads of cattle and two dairy cows. The dairy cows are cared for by his wife. She feeds and milks them. Every day, they get 10 liters of milk and Mahmud's wife produces yogurt products and sells them to acquaintances and neighbors. Additionally, Mahmud is engaged in mid-sized village farming on "dekhan" farms. But the main source of income is fattening cattle. 

Mahmud is trying to expand his business and hopes to use the loan to buy another cow and feed for the cattle. Mahmud thanks Arvand in advance for the help and assistance.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Shafozil

texts.ru: Шафозил молодой, энергичный и жизнерадостный человек. Ему 28 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети Афшин и Шахбону еще маленькие. Его жена Мутриба домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Шафозил является единственным кормильцем в семье. Более 6 лет он занимается услуги таксиста, а также, транспортные сельскохозяйственные услуги, как услуга трактора и комбайна. Он хочет развевать бизнес и таким образом увеличить доход. От полученного дохода он планирует купить новые технологии своим детям. Так как он живет в отдаленном регионе, он хочет, чтобы его дети росли информированными, не отставая от современного развивающего мира. Он запрашивает займ для покупки комбайна. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shafozil is a young, energetic and cheerful person. He is 28 years old. He is married and has three children. His children Afshin and Shahbonu are still small. His wife Mutriba is a homemaker and is busy raising the children. Shafozil is the sole breadwinner for the family. 

For more than six years, he has been involved in taxi services, and also agricultural transportation services, like tractor and combine. He wants to develop his business and thus increase revenue. He plans to use the income to buy new technology for his children. Since he lives in a remote region, he wants his children to grow up informed, keeping up with the modern developing world. He is asking for a loan to buy a combine.

loans.use: to buy a combine for his transportation business

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 46 years old. She lives in Borjomi district with her 46-year-old husband, 22-year-old daughter (Natela) and 23-year-old son (George). Nana has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for the family business start-up but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The main source of the income for the family is the monthly salaries of Nana and her children. Nana is working as an old man’s nurse; her son is working at the local TV station as an operator; and her daughter is working at the local shop as a seller. In addition, Nana’s husband is getting a small monthly pension from government institutions as he is a war veteran. 

Nana requested loan from Credo to start up the family business. Nana has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Nana will renovate her house. She will purchase all the needed materials and pay the artisan. After the house is renovated, Nana will rent the rooms out during the summer season. Because Borjomi district is becoming very popular as a tourist area and every summer is very crowded, Nana hopes her business will be profitable. New business will significantly increase the family income, and Nana will be able to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to rent it out seasonally.

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
El Sr. Patricio es cliente de la fundación desde el año 2006, el mismo vive en casa propia en la ciudad de Luque, es casado y tiene 4 hijos.- Patricio tiene una granja que se dedica a la siembra de frutas y hortalizas en su casa y también en la ciudad de Horqueta, además es jubilado.
Patricio es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre ha trabajo y se ha esforzado por dar a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan para una vida mejor.
Solicita de este préstamo para compra de semillas e insecticidas, ya que los necesita para invertirlos en su cultivo, ya que son insumos elementales. Dicho préstamo le será de mucha ayuda, no solo a el, sino también a su familia.
texts.en:
Patricio has been a customer of the foundation since 2006. He lives in his own home in the city of Luque and is married with 4 children. Patricio has a fruit and vegetable farm at home and also in the city of Horqueta - he is also retired.

Patricio is a person who has a great desire to succeed. He has always worked and strived to give his family everything that they need for a better life.

He is asking for this loan to be able to buy seeds and insecticide as he needs them to invest in the harvest as they are fundamental ingredients.

He says that this loan will be a great help, not only to him, but also to his whole family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and insecticide.

loans.name: Armie

texts.en: Armie is a 32-year-old woman from the community of Ubay, Bohol. She is married with two children, ages 5 and 11. She has been engaged in raising hogs for two years now in order to help support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy feed, medicine and rice. Armie hopes to have a better income out of her business so that she can pay for daily consumption and school fees of her children. In the future, she hopes to be successful in this business and raise more hogs for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy feed, medicine and rice.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 44-year-old mother from Kisumu city which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Omondi who is a business man, and they are blessed with three children who are 15, 13 and 8 years old respectively.

She has a bakery at her residence. She has been doing this business for the last 12 years and makes a monthly income of 15,000 KES. She has applied for her second loan with KADET LTD which she will use to purchase an oven for her business. This will help her improve her productivity. She will use the anticipated profit to grow her business. She has a dream of growing her business into a big one and also to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase another oven.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: For the past several years, Bahati has operated a retail shop in her home where she sells to her neighbors and passersby. She also also operates a dry-fish-selling business which earns her additional income on the side. Her main challenges are the seasonal nature of her work and late payments by creditors. She is requesting a loan for Kshs 100,000 to buy maize flour, beans, sugar and sacks of dry fish to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, beans, sugar and sacks of dry fish.

loans.name: Ko'e Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Ko'e Pyahu está en su ciclo número 7, lleva ese nombre que en castellano significa nuevo amanecer, ya que eso es para ellas este grupo, un nuevo amanecer y nuevas oportunidades. Ellas están saliendo adelante y quieren poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa de comités.
Hilder se dedica a la lavandería, cuenta que todos los días se dedica a lavar las prendas de los clientes que le llevan. Es un trabajo muy sacrificado pero ella lo hace con mucho esfuerzo para poder darle a su familia lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de jabones, suavizantes, y demás insumos para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group Ko'e Pyahu is in its 7th loan cycle. They have this name, which means "new dawn" as that is what this new group means to them: a new dawn and new opportunities. They are doing well and they want to be able to reach the maximum level in the communal bank programme.

Hilder has a laundrette, she says that everyday she washes the items that her customers bring her. It is very difficult work, but she works hard to be able to give her family everything that they need so that they do not have to suffer any kind of deprivation.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy soaps, softeners and other ingredients to keep giving her customers good service. She is grateful for the opportunity that they are all receiving.

loans.use: to buy soaps and softener.

loans.name: Hermesa

texts.en: Hermesa is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of five grown up children from Antequera, Bohol. Hermesa runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Hermesa is asking for a loan to buy stock to sell like canned goods, rice, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to cater and sell to more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and profit. Hermesa dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like canned goods, rice, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Olimkhon

texts.ru: Олимхон добрый и жизнерадостный человек. Ему 59 лет. Он живет один. Он разведен и не имеет детей. Он занимается выращиванием зерновых и овощных культур. Ежегодно он делает посев пшеницы, картошки и баклажана. Он очень умелый фермер и каждый год получает хороший урожай. Полученный урожай он продает на местном рынке. Олимхон имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Они очень довольны его товаром. Олимхон хочет сделать посев, но не имеет денег для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 650 долларов США. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Olimkhon is a good and cheerful person. He is 59 years old. He lives alone. He is divorced and does not have any children. He is engaged in the cultivation of grain and vegetable crops. Every year, he sows wheat, potatoes, and eggplants. He is a very skilled farmer and each year gets a good harvest. He sells the resulting crop in the local market. Olimkhon has his own loyal customers. They are very happy with his goods. 

Olimkhon wants to grow a crop, but does not have the money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. He is asking for a loan of $650.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for land where he grows wheat, potatoes, and eggplants

loans.name: Sodirjon

texts.ru: Содирчон целеустремленный человек. Ему 31 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети еще несовершеннолетние. Содирчон вместе семьей живет в сельской местности, где природа прекрасно и имеется хорошее условие для скотоводства и выращивание сельхоз культуры. Более 10 лет Содирчон занимается скотоводством и выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Данное время он имеет 2 коровы. Содирчон выращивает огурцы и помидоры, которые приносят много дохода. Его жена помогает ему введение бизнеса. Его родители живут вместе с ним и поэтому он должен развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода для обеспечения большой семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота и минерального удобрения. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sodirjon is a goal-oriented person. He is 31 years old. He is married with three children. The children are still young. Sodirjon lives with his family in the countryside, where nature is beautiful and has good conditions for the cultivation of livestock and agricultural crops. For more than ten years, Sodirjon has been involved in livestock and agriculture. At this time, he has two cows. Sodirjon grows cucumbers and tomatoes, which bring a good income. His wife helps him in conducting the business. 

His parents live with him and so must develop the business and to generate more revenue to provide the large family with all the needed means. 

He is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy livestock and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy livestock and mineral fertilizers for developing his business

loans.name: Madre Central Group

texts.es:
El comité Madre Central pasa al cuarto ciclo, todas las señoras se dedican a la cría de animales pequeños como gallinas y cerdos también venden huevos y quesos. Los días lunes y viernes realizan feria de sus productos frente a la oficina de la fundación paraguaya.  Ellas son de una zona muy lejana de la ciudad, no tienen mucho acceso a la comunicación, pero es por eso que se esfuerzan, para poder ayudar a sus familias y su comunidad.
Lidia, es una de las que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, solicita de este crédito para la compra de cerdos pequeños para la cría, y también de balanceados para sus demás animales. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de Kiva y fundacion.
texts.en:
The communal bank Madre Central has reached its 4th cycle, all the women work in animal husbandry raising animals like chickens and pigs as well as selling eggs and cheeses. 

Mondays to Fridays they go to the market to sell their products opposite the fundacion paraguaya office. They are from an area far from the city, and do not have much access to communications, but this is why they work hard to be able to provide for their families and their community.

Lidia is a member who raises and sells animals, she is asking for this loan to buy small pigs so she can raise them and also feed for her other animals. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving from Kiva and the foundation.

loans.use: to buy small pigs to raise them and buy feed.

loans.name: Teco Pyahu Recavo Group

texts.es:
Teco Pyahu Recavo es un grupo de la ciudad de San Pedro, la cual esta a distancia muy lejana de las principales formas de comunicación, las integrantes se encuentran en lejanas localidades y hay días que cuando llueve les es imposible salir. Ellas están trabajando juntas para poder salir adelante y también poder ayudar a su comunidad a resurgir.
Todas ellas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, patos, pavos y demás tipos. Cuentan que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pero que ellas lo hacen para salir adelante.
Teodora solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, para que de esa forma siga con sus ventas de animales.
texts.en:
Teco Pyahu Recavo is a group from the city of San Pedro, which is very far from the main forms of transport, the members are very far from local amenities and there are days when the rain makes it impossible to go out. They work together to be able to succeed and also so they can help their community to get back on track.

All of them raise and sell animals, like chickens, pigs, ducks, turkeys and other things. They say that their work is very hard, but they do it to get ahead.

Teodora is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in buying feed for their animals so they can continue to sell their animals.

loans.use: to buy feed for animals.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 48-year-old married man and the father of three children. He is a Palestinian refugee, living and working in Lebanon.

For the past 21 years Ahmad has been working in the coffee business. In 2005 he started his own business to improve his living and increase his income.

Ahmad is a hard worker and puts much effort into keeping his machines up to date to keep his customers happy. He is applying for a 1700 USD loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a new espresso machine. He will also use part of the loan to pay for his son's university fees. He hopes to keep on developing his business and providing for his family.

loans.use: to buy a new espresso machine.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 22, is a young man from Usenge, which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Lillian and is blessed with a one-year-old child. For the last six years Joseph has fished to make money. He now makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Joseph is applying for a 55,000 KES loan, his second from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy fishing nets. He will use the anticipated profits to better his fishing. He dreams of venturing into another business so as to stop fishing for a living and raise his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира с детства любила красивых женщин и мечтала стать ухоженной леди. После окончания средней школы она ходила в салон учеником и научилась делать маникюр, педикюр. Назира данное время является мастером своего дела. Ей 30 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дети еще не совершеннолетние. Ее муж простой рабочий и получает маленькую зарплату, которая не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Поэтому Назира упорно работает, чтобы больше зарабатывать деньги. Назира работает в салоне, который находится в городе, где она живет вместе семьей. Благодаря хорошему сервису она имеет своих клиентов. Назира старается предоставлять услуги на высшем уровне и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки инструментов для своей деятельности. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на вашу благотворительность.
texts.en:
Since childhood, Nazira has loved beautiful women and wanted to grow up to be a well-groomed lady. After graduating high school, she went to salon training and learned how to do manicures and pedicures. Nazira today is a master of her craft. 

She is 30 years old. She is married and has two children, who are still young. Her husband is a simple worker and receives a small salary, which is not enough for providing the family with all it needs. Therefore, Nazira is working hard to earn more money. 

Nazira works in a salon located in the city where she lives with her family.  Due to good service, she has her own customers. Nazira tries to provide services at the highest level and therefore she is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy equipment for her activities.

loans.use: to buy equipment for a beauty salon

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman, and she has six children, three of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling as a wholesaler to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in the business. Masika dreams of establishing a vegetable stall in the future.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба трудолюбивая и добрая женщина. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Матлюба вместе семьей живет счастливо, но бедно. Она работает уборщицей в аэропорте. Ее зарплата и зарплата ее мужа ели-ели хватает на жизнь. Ее дети тоже еще не имеют большой доход. В этом году ее сын хочет жениться. Однако, Матлюба и ее муж не имеют денег, чтобы провести свадебное торжество сына. Матлюба не смогла отказаться любимому сыну и поэтому обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества. Этот займ поможет этой доброй женщине сделать счастливым ее сына. Она ждет вашу доброту и как добросовестная женщина обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en:
Matluba is a hardworking and kind woman. She is 48 years old. She is married with four children. Matluba's family lives happily together, but they are poor. She works as a cleaner at the airport. Her salary and the salary of her husband are more or less enough to live on. Her children also do not have a large income. 

This year, her son wants to get married. However, Matluba and her husband do not have the money to spend on a wedding ceremony for their son. Matluba could not refuse her beloved son and therefore asked for a loan. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni for a wedding celebration. This loan will help this good woman to make her son happy. 

She awaits support and, as a conscientious woman, promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to put on a wedding party for her son

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a forty-year-old woman from the community of Ubay, Bohol. She is married with three children ages seven, twelve and sixteen.

For the past three years Arlene has raised hogs. She is applying for a 6000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy another piglet plus feed and supplements. Raising hogs requires a lot of perseverance since one has to wait many months before seeing a profit. Arlene works hard, though, and she knows that with the help of the loan she will be able to take care of her pigs well.

In the future Arlene hopes to see her children being successful in their studies.

loans.use: to buy a piglet plus feed and supplements.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Anne is 40 years old and lives in Kisumu city, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to John, who works in a petrol station and supports the family. She has four kids, who are 18, 15, 10 and 7 years old.

She has a beauty salon that she operates alone. She has been doing this business for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. She has applied for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase a blow dryer and braids for her business. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

She has a dream of opening more beauty salons, so as to earn more income. This would help her to care better for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a blow dryer and braids for the salon.

loans.name: Mehry

texts.ru: Мехри трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Благодаря родителям, она окончила Медицинский Колледж, и данное время работает медсестрой в городской поликлинике. Она работает медсестрой. Мехри очень любит свою работу и с удовольствием ухаживает за больными. Все ее коллеги уважают и  знают как честную женщину. Мехри получает маленькую зарплату и поэтому не может сделать сбережения для покупки не обходимого средства для улучшения домохозяйства. Она хочет купить кровать, так как она спит на полу и стиральную машинку, так как она делает стирку вручную и ее руки тряслись от порошка и горячей воды. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки кровати и стиральной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mehry is a hardworking woman. She is married and has three children. Thanks to her parents, she graduated from Medical College and currently works as a nurse in an urban clinic. Mehry loves her job a lot and enjoys caring for the sick. All her colleagues respect her and think of her as an honest woman. 

Mehry receives a small salary and therefore can not save up to purchase needed items to improve her household. She wants to buy a bed, since she sleeps on the floor, and a washing machine, since she does the laundry by hand and her hands tremble from the powder and hot water. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy a bed and a washing machine.

loans.use: to buy a bed and washing machine for her household

loans.name: Siboniso

texts.en:
Siboniso is a Business Management Student of the Maharishi Institute. Siboniso is 21 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?
“I am currently studying a business degree at Maharishi Institute. The classes that I enjoy most are Higher States of Consciousness because they help to connect with the inner being.”

What are your goals after graduation?
“My goal after graduating is to work for Anglo American in the Finance Department then start my own warehousing and logistics company. I would like to work within the city of Johannesburg so that I don't travel much.”

Tell us about your background.
“I was born and raised in Katlehong, east side of Johannesburg. I stay in Katlehong and I have four brothers and one sister. My father works at Afrox as a part-time driver and my mother works as a consultant for Old Mutual. I am not married and I don’t have any children or kids.”

What do you do in your spare time?
“In my spare time I like to read and cook because I love cooking and if I’m not doing those two, I also like to search for something on the internet.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?
“The Kiva loan, for me it will do some significant changes both in my life and studies. Firstly I know that I will get to school or I will be able to go to school every day no matter what and secondly the Kiva loan will give me an assurance that my tuition is secured and covered.”

loans.use: to pay for one year tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is single and has been blessed with three, school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Mwanahamisi has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge from the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan amount of KES 25,000, she wants to purchase vegetables and fruits to resell, including sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and various fruits. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits to resell, including sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and various fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 21-year-old, married man, who has one child and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has completed secondary school. He started up a small business four years ago. He has a fabrics store. He has a lovely and cooperative wife. She was ready to sell her jewelry, in order to provide her husband with the capital needed to open the store and improve their living conditions.

He has applied for a youth loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to buy a new range of fabrics, so that he can increase his income. He looks forward to completing his higher education, and opening a savings account for his daughter to secure her future.  He would like also to expand his business and open another store, to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy a new range of fabrics, so that he can increase his income.

loans.name: William Cesar

texts.es:
Wiliam es un joven de 22 años de carácter alegre y con  muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es por ello que cada día William trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y entusiasmo como obrero en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad, el trabaja sobre todo para poder apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar ya que son de condición humilde, William labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque e smuy responsable y sobre todo porque quiere progresar.

Wiliam está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales como calaminas, maderas, clavos, entre otros  para mejorar el techo de su vivienda ya que hay intensas lluvias y por ello se inunda su vivienda, de esta manera podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
William, age 22, is a young man of cheerful character who has tremendous drive to succeed. For this reason, he works with great effort and enthusiasm each day as an employee for a small company in the city. Williams works hard so that he can help his mother with the household expenses since they live in modest conditions. He works more than nine hours a day and believes he is doing well in his work because he is very responsible and has the desire to make progress.

William is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, he will be able to buy materials such as corrugated iron, wood, nails, and other supplies for repairing the roof of his house. Whenever there are heavy rains, his home is inundated with water. Making this improvement will provide a better quality of life for his family. William continues to strive toward fulfilling his greatest wish of having a house of his own.

loans.use: to buy corrugated iron, wood, nails, and other supplies for repairing the roof.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Medalla Milagrosa son mujeres de Ciudad del Este están en su ciclo número 13º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Quieren dar a sus hijos lo que ellas no pudieron, y es por ello que trabajan de día a día.
Irma una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo. Cuenta que sus ventas son muy buenas, en especial los fines de semana que es cuando más gente tiene, y cuenta también que su principal meta es poder tener un gran local de ventas el día de mañana.
Irma solicita de este crédito para la compra de gaseosas, jugos, cervezas, vinos y demás, ya que con ello podrá tener bien surtido su negocio y seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank group, Medalla Milagrosa, is made up of women from  the city of Este. They are in their 13th cycle as a committee of women, in which they all work and help one another to get ahead. They want to give to their children what they were not able to have, which is what motivates them to work day after day. 

Irma, one of the group members, sells a variety of types of drinks. She mentioned that her sales are going very well, especially on the weekends when they are more people. She said that her personal goal is to have a large store front someday soon. Irma has requested this loan to buy sodas, juices, beer, wine and other beverages, so that her business will be well stocked and she will be able to continue offering a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, beer and wine, among other beverages.

loans.name: Ramarumo

texts.en:
Ramarumo is a Business Management student of the Maharishi Institute. Ramarumo is 22 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?
“Business Administration. The classes I enjoy most are Consciousness-Based Knowledge because they like us to think from a level of creation, Elementary Algebra 1 & 2, Economics, and most of all, English class.”

What are your goals after graduation?
“My goal is to become the best and to give back to the community in order to get what I got. The sector I expect to work under is managing my own business, so that many unemployed people may be employed, and I would like to be one of the donors around the city of Johannesburg.”

Tell us about your background.
“I was born and raised by a single parent, my mother, who is the mother of four. I was born in Gauteng in the Vaal Sharpville. I am the second born at home. We're only living with one parent “mother” at home, taking care of four children by a Government Support Grant. I have three sisters; my one sister is studying Management. My mother is currently not working and is in high hopes of getting a job to take care of her family. My father left us eight years ago and he never came back home.”

What do you do in your spare time?
“In my spare time I like reading, playing around the Internet and socializing with friends and families in and around South Africa. I usually use most of my spare time doing something that will generate a benefit to me in the long run.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?
“The Kiva loan will bring a very huge change in my life because it’s the only cash I am going to rely on for living expenses. The loan is going to bring gigantic change in my academic results because I am going to get to school easily and be credited to some school points, which brings significant change like changing the transport I am using currently.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Itrat

texts.en:
Ms Itrat is 33 years old and a married woman. She has five children. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health care. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business, to contribute to the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community.

To complete the orders on time, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000. She will use it to buy sewing supplies, including a stock of thread of various colors and packs of buttons and needles. With these supplies, she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies, including a stock of thread of various colors, and packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Ms. Nazia is a 24-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store to contribute to the family income. Her husband is a security guard, but his income is not enough to cover household expenditures. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to support her husband financially in running the household. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Launiyada

texts.en: Launiyada is a 30-year-old married woman with eight children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 11 years now she has been operating a retail shop, and she started the business after realizing that farming could not facilitate her in meeting the family daily expenses. Price fluctuation coupled with inadequate capital pose a challenge to her business growth while her dreams are educating children and owning a wholesale shop. Launiyada intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise such as salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Farooq

texts.en:
Ms Farooq is a 34-year-old, married woman. She is the mother of one child and is motivated to provide all facilities of life to her family. She has been running a small general store in her community for the past five years. Her husband assists her in running this business. The man shown in the photo is Farooq’s husband. She has good communication skills and counts a good client list.

Because of having low cash in hand, she has faced difficulties in buying a stock of goods from the market at wholesales rates. That is why she requested a loan of PKR 30,000. She will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and other grains, to resell at her general store. With the help of this loan, she will be able to meet the increasing demands of her customers timely, which ultimately will help her to generate more revenue. She wishes to utilize part of her profits to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital. She is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice and other grains, to resell at her general store.

loans.name: Keketso

texts.en:
Keketso is a Business Management student of the Maharishi Institute. Keketso is 24 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?
“I am currently studying Business Administration at the Maharishi Institute with the intention of obtaining first a Bachelor of Business Administration degree and then a Masters of Business Administration degree.”

What are your goals after graduation?
"My ultimate goals are to become a Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of at least two companies that are not my own, and also establish my own organizations, both locally and internationally. I have a wide variety of interests; thus the sectors in which I will work include mining, banking, health, insurance, public sector, energy and fashion. I see myself becoming a global citizen; thus I intend to work in different cities, meaning that I will get to travel and also see first-hand how my international organizations are progressing."

Tell us about your background?
“I was born in Gauteng in a township called Vosloorus. I was, however, raised by a single parent, my mother, as my father passed away a year after I was born. I am the only child at home. My mother is a self-employed seamstress, and that is how she is able to provide for us and put me through school. She is my source of inspiration, as seeing how hard she worked to educate me motivates me, and this has shown me that nothing is impossible when hard work and passion come together.”

What do you do in your spare time?
“In my spare time I read, write and jot down all of the business ideas that I get and also plan on how I will start and manage my business. I also design clothing and volunteer at orphanages.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?
“The Kiva loan will make a significant difference in my life, as making ends meet has been a big challenge since I began pursuing this degree. With this loan, I will be able to not only pay for tuition, but also pay for most of my basic necessities. This loan will help ease the pressure I experience when there are financial costs that need to be covered, and I don’t have the means to do so.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Pedro Ángel

texts.es: Don Pedro de 52 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto con su esposa y un hijo, Don Pedro se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 10 años. Es muy conocido como un buen agricultor el cual se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable y honrado.  Cada año cultiva la tierra con variedad de granos y hortalizas, es un hombre creativo el cual saca provecho a la tierra que posee. Este año quiere invertir en los insumos para el cultivo de maíz ya que sin ellos la milpa no se desarrolla como tal y no hay probabilidades de tener una cosecha abundante, por eso solicita un credito para poder comprar abono, fertilizates, semillas entre otras cosas y asi seguirle dando a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Don Pedro, age 52, lives in his own home with his wife and son. He has been farming for more than 10 years. Pedro is well-known as a good farmer who is hardworking, responsible, and honest. Each year he cultivates the land with a variety of grains and vegetables. Pedro is a creative man who strives to take advantage of the land he owns.

This year he wants to invest in supplies for growing corn because his crops will not develop without them, thus eliminating any opportunities to achieve an abundant harvest. For this reason, Pedro is requesting a loan so that he can buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, and other supplies in order to continue providing better financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, seeds, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Sumaya

texts.en: Ms Sumaya is a 20-year-old unmarried lady who is living with her family in Punjab, Pakistan. For about five years, she has been working in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to develop a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she requested for a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Sumaya dreams of building her own house as she is living in a rented house with her family. She is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins, and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Kaneno

texts.en:
Kaneno is a widow with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither piped water nor electricity. 

Kaneno operates a vegetable business, selling at the market to her local customers. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and carrots for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and carrots for resale.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en: Ms. Shumaila has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over two years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. She has requested a loan worth 20,000 PKR to purchase spools of threads and packs of sequins, beads, and pearls in various colors. She says that the females in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Shumaila has taken up. She has five childre,n and she wants to provide them with good education, food, and health facilities.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads and packs of sequins, beads, and pearls in various colors.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms Nasreen is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She has been running a small general store with her husband for the last five years. Her husband performs the duty of purchasing stock of goods from the market while Nasreen stays at the shop and deals with customers. They make enough to bear everyday expenditures of the family members. In order to make her store fully stocked she needs to purchase stock of cleaning products such as soaps and shampoos as well as packs of grains and beverages. For this reason she applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. She dreams of providing quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cleaning products such as soaps and shampoos as well as packs of grains and beverages.

loans.name: Dalfa Noema

texts.es:
Delfa tiene 32 años de edad es soltero vive con la familia en el Cantón  Chimbo  Provincia Bolívar.


Delfa se  dedica a la agricultura. 

 Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, ureas, abonos y demás productos químicos.

  Las compra en el cantón chimbo.

 Su sueño es de ampliar el negocio. 

 El   desafío que se enfrentan luchar con cualquier problema que se presente. 

 En el tiempo libre le gusta  reírse con su familia.
texts.en: Delfa is 32 years old, single and lives with her family in the canton of Chimbo, in the province of Bolivar. She makes a living as a farmer. She has requested this loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, urea, organic fertilizers and chemical products. She will purchase the supplies in the canton of Chimbo. Her dream is to expand her business. Her current challenge is facing whatever problems come up. During her free time she likes to laugh with her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, urea, organic fertilizers and chemical products.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a Business Management student at the Maharishi Institute. Nelly is 22 years old and was asked the following questions by a staff member of the Institute:

What do you study at the Maharishi Institute and what classes do you enjoy most?
“I'm studying Business Administration. I am enjoying all my classes, but classes that I enjoy the most are Physiology of Consciousness and Principles of Business Success and Business Fundamentals.”

What are your goals after graduation?
“After graduation I plan to work in any company in a marketing department, so that I can make money to start my own business and build the dance studio where I will teach kids to dance. I would like to work in Johannesburg or Durban. I would like to travel to different cities and countries because I like to experience new things.”

Tell us about your background?
“I was born in Tembisa Hospital. When I was four years old, I was moved to Kwahdebele Mpumalanga to start my primary school level there. I am the last born and the only girl, and I have two brothers. My father passed away in 2011. My mom is a domestic worker, and she is the breadwinner. I am not married and I also do not have children. After my father’s death, things were not easy for my mother because she had to provide everything for all of us, and sometime it is hard because she can’t do things for herself.”

What do you do in your spare time?
“In my spare time I like to read novels and relax. And I like to spend time with my family and go out watching movies.”

How will the Kiva loan change your life?
“I will have no fear that I will drop out before I finish my studies, and I know that Kiva will help me to pay for my studies; it will help me to change my lifestyle to better. I would learn to save so that I can pay the loan back.”

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 43 years old, and a cafe and butchery owner in Bombolulu, Mombasa. He is a married father of one, whose spouse brings in additional income. He has been in his business for the past three years and has done great.

This marks his second borrowing from KADET LTD, after servicing the first loan successfully. He will use the new loan to buy more stock of foodstuffs to use in the cafeteria, including meat, maize flour, wheat flour, and sugar. He will use the anticipated profit to service his loan and expand his business venture. He hopes to excel in all his future endeavors.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat and other foodstuffs, to use in the cafeteria.

loans.name: Nussrat

texts.en:
Ms Nussrat has been running a small general store in her community, with the help of her husband, for the past nine years. She is 48 years old, a married woman, and a loving mother of six children. Three of her children are school-going.  She earns enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband assists her by purchasing goods from the market to stock the store, as he has maintained many contacts there for years.

Nussrat is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health care. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000. She will use this amount to buy packs of salt, biscuits and grains, to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and grains, to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy household appliances like a refrigerator, washing machine and other things.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Ms. Robina had a difficult time so she decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. She has two children. Fifteen years ago she began making knives with her husband in her house. The man shown in the photo is Robina’s husband. They both make knives in different sizes and sell them to the people of their community in the local market. In this way they make an income to support the entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds they are unable to meet the orders on time. This why Robina applied a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase raw materials like good quality steel and plastic handles along with boxes for packing. Her goal is to increase her output and her sales. She will use part of the additional income she earns to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like good quality steel and plastic handles along with boxes for packing.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms Nasreen is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She and her husband have worked in agriculture for twenty years. She grows different vegetables and fruits and sells them in the local market. In order to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides, she applied a loan of 25,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds and packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Alan Miguel

texts.es:
Alan vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad con un clima cálido y acogedor, y poseedor de playas hermosas, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de maíz, algodón, entre otros.  Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Alan logro estudiar mecánica de mantenimiento y gracias a ello cada día Alan se levanta muy temprano ya que él trabaja como mecánico en un pequeño taller de su ciudad, Alan labora alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar; él cree que está saliendo adelante por su dedicación y su responsabilidad.

Alan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar un ´pequeño local para poder iniciar un negocio, de esta manera podrá poco a poco formar su propio taller de mecánica y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Tener un nuevo negocio y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Alan lives in Pisco, a city with a warm and welcoming climate, as well as beautiful beaches. This area is also developed in agriculture, especially in terms of corn, cotton, and other crops. With great effort and dedication, Alan was able to study to become an auto mechanic. He now wakes up early each day so that he can head to his job as a mechanic at a small repair shop in the city. Alan works approximately nine hours a day and the income from his job allows him to help his parents with the household expenses. He believes that he is succeeding because of his dedication and responsibility.

Alan is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, he will be able to buy a small space for starting his business. Over time he will be able to establish his own auto repair shop so that he can improve his earnings. Alan continues to strive toward fulfilling his greatest wish of opening a new business and having a house of his own.

loans.use: to acquire a space for opening his auto repair shop.

loans.name: Ajaib

texts.en: Ms Ajaib is a 58-year-old married woman. She has one kid and her husband is a driver but his income is not enough to meet the household expenses.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching and earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will spend the part of income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Segundo Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 29 años de edad es soltero tiene una hija vive con su hija en el Cantón Chimbo  Provincia Bolívar. 

Lorenzo se dedica a la venta de sandalias al por  menor. 

 Solicita el crédito para la adquisición de mas mercadería para la feria.  

Las compras lo realizan en  Guayaquil cada 15 días. 

Su sueño es mejorar el negocio para así mejorar  la calidad de vida  de mi familia. 

 El desafío que enfrenta es a veces la perdida en el negocio  por la competencia.    

 En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear con la hija.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 29 years old, single, and has a daughter. He lives with her in Chimbo Canton, Bolivar Province. Lorenzo sells sandals at retail.

Lorenzo is requesting a loan for buying merchandise to sell at the local fair. He makes his purchases in the city of Guayaquil every 15 days.

Lorenzo's dream is to improve his business in order to better his family's quality of life. The challenge he confronts, at times, is loss of business to the competition. Lorenzo likes to spend his free time with his daughter.

loans.use: to acquire more merchandise for sale at the local fair.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en: Ms Sakeena is a 39-year-old married woman. Three years ago, she started her own business of clothing sales. She buys clothes of different designs from the market in bulk at lower rates and sells them in her community. She has a good client list, most of her clients are her neighbors. She is mother of five children, two of them are going to school. She wishes to send the other children to school but is unable to cover the expenses. She has gradually improved her business, now she requests a loan of 25,000 PKR. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of clothes in a larger quantity to add to her current ones. She hopes to get boost in her net income and intends to use the earned profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy an ample variety of cloths in a larger quantity to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José    tiene 46 años de edad es casado tiene 2 hijos   vive con su esposa e hijos en el Cantón Chimbo Provincia Bolívar.


José  se dedica a la agricultura.

 Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos, fertilizantes, semillas y demás productos necesarios para la siembra. 

 La compra se realiza en la ciudad se Chimbo. 

  Su sueño es seguir ampliando el negocio.

 El desafío que enfrenta es luchar contra cualquier problema. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirse con   la familia.
texts.en: José is 46 years old. He is married with two chidren. He lives with his wife and their children in the canton of Chimbo, in the province of Bolívar. José makes a living working as a farmer. He has requested a loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, seeds and other products that are necessary for planting. He will make his purchases in the city of Chimbo. His dream is to continue expanding his business. The challenge that he faces is working against whatever problem arises. In his free time he likes to get together with his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies, fertilizers, seeds and other products that are necessary for planting.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a retail shop but also offers carpentry services. The businesses have been very lucrative, and with the proceeds he has been able to buy land and pay school fees for his children. Like most traders, he has a hardship of price fluctuation while his dream is to trade in wholesale. Moses intends to use the loan to buy buy maize flour, rice, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, salt, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Ramzan

texts.en:
